You can record macros with the 'q' command, then replay them as many times as you want. Here are a couple walkthroughs. http://www.thegeekstuff.com/2009/01/vi-and-vim-macro-tutorial-how-to-record-and-play http://vimcasts.org/episodes/converting-markdown-to-structured-html-with-a-macro

Yakshemash! Macros are defined in runtime. What you need is a command - plugin. I wrote a simple plugin for converting xhtml2html (sorry i got caught up and switched places :) ) https://gist.github.com/925185 You can see how easy is to write a plugin for trivial tasks like this. To activate this, just put it in your plugins dir or :source it. Try to extend it for the other tags (input, meta etc).
@dekomote "command! -nargs=0 Xhtml2html call Xhtml2html()" wat does this do, good sir?
Defines a command Xhtml2html (you call it with  :Xhtml2html) that calls the function Xhtml2html(). -nargs specifies how many arguments does that command take.
